Author: urish
Content: Do tell more - since in the docs/tooling, we use gf180mcuD when referring to the PDK

Author: urish
Content: But when talking in general about the process, we usually shorten to GF180

Author: mithro_
Content: Yeah, don't shorten to GF180, fine to shorten gf180mcuD to GF180MCU though.

Author: urish
Content: We will also need to rethink our shuttle naming convention at some point

Author: urish
Content: ttgf26[abcdef...]   won't easily scale to multiple processes

Author: mole99
Content: To clear things up: GF180MCU is the process. gf180mcu is the PDK family and gf180mcuA/B/C/D are the PDK variants.

Author: mole99
Content: Same for SKY130, sky130 and sky130A/B.

Author: mole99
Content:
IHP is a bit different though üòÖ 
There it's: SG13G2 (or SG13CMOS), ihp-sg13g2 and ihp-sg13g2 (family and variant are the same).

Author: mithro_
Content: GF180IC and GF180BCDLite would be potential future GF 180nm techs

Author: urish
Content: And I was sure it stands for "Intelligent Creatures"

Author: algofoogle
Content: I just thought it was really cold üòâ ü•∂

Author: mithro_
Content: My understanding is that GF180IC allows designs which were targeted at "other foundries standard 180nm process nodes (like say TSMC's 180nm node)" to be manufactured with no changes (except changing GDS layer ids). It may have been used when things like second sourcing where required.

Author: mithro_
Content: BCDLite is a cost optimized version of GF's BCD process technology. BCD (bipolar-CMOS-DMOS) technology allows to drive discrete high voltage components (several hundred of operating voltage) at high frequency while keeping high integration with advanced CMOS technology nodes.
